params.name: config
params.description:
This is the main configuration for your BrowserSync instance and can contain any of the [available options]({{site.links.options}})
 If you do not pass a config an argument for configuration, BrowserSync will still run; but it will be in the `snippet` mode

params.name: cb
params.description:
If you pass a callback function, it will be called when BrowserSync has completed all setup tasks and is ready to use. This
is useful when you need to wait for information (for example: urls, port etc) or perform other tasks synchronously.

description: The `reload` method will inform all browsers about changed files and will either cause the browser to refresh, or inject the files where possible.
name: reload

params.name: arg
params.description:
The file or files to be reloaded. For
details and examples of Streams support, please see the [GulpJS]({{site.links.gulp}}) examples

params.name: msg
params.description: Can be a simple message such as 'Connected' or HTML

params.name: timeout
params.description: How long the message will remain in the browser. @since 1.3.0

description: This method will close any running server, stop file watching & exit the current process.
name: exit

description: Method to pause file change events
name: pause

description: A simple true/false flag to determine if the current instance is paused
name: paused

description: A simple true/false flag that you can use to determine if there's a currently-running BrowserSync instance.
name: active

description:
The internal Event Emitter used by the running BrowserSync instance (if there is one).
You can use this to emit your own events, such as changed files, logging etc.
name: emitter
